intro: Androsace duthieana, commonly known as the Duthie's rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and dense clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Androsace duthieana is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
